statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 8 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -26 \\ -10 \\ -8 \\ -2 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 8 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ 7 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -26 \\ -10 \\ -8 \\ -2 \end{array}\right].
